climbs.name: Where there is a Will there is a Way
climbs.fa: David Blattel, Bill Leventhal, Will Oxx, August 2009

content.location: Starts at a black water streak 200' right of the North Face.

climbs.name: Where there is a Wall there is a Way

content.description: 5 new pitches (see topo), then joins Will for upper 4 pitches.
content.location: Starts at a double crack system 150' right of Will…

climbs.name: Watchtower - North Face
climbs.fa: Alyse Bertenthal, Jay Kumar, Bob Steed, August 2009

content.description: The first pitch ascends the right of an obvious pair of parallel, vertical cracks. Continue up and right of a large arête.
content.location: Begin 300' right of the NE Face.

content.description:
Approach the left side of the north face and begin at a ladder of small horizontal dikes. Ascend directly up and enter the gully to the left of the large arête.

Descent: Rappel from bolts in a large block facing the south summit, pass around the south summit on the left via 3rd/4th-class ledges, and go west to the saddle above Tower Lake. Hike down past Tower Lake to the trail.
content.location: Hike 15 miles from Leavitt Meadows on the Sonora Pass highway, up the West Walker River to the base of the north face, which rises 1,500' above an avalanche meadow.

content.description: Crack system with 3 5.8 pitches - see topo.
content.location: At the right side of the north face.

content.description: The route starts at Tower Lake and is off trail, although you may see footprints here and there. It is mostly 2nd class, with a bit of 3rd near the summit. The summit register shows a lot of traffic.
content.location: Northwest Face. Start from Tower Lake, stay left of the lake and aim for Tower Pass. Just before you top out at the pass, climb out on the left side. Aim for the ridge above the scrub brush. Then head to the NW chute. To descend, retrace your steps
